attributes.action: consider awarding an Honour to Daniel Fergus "Danny" McGrain for services to Association Football at domestic and international level.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Despite being diagnosed with diabetes in 1974, in his prime, there was no better full-back in world football than Daniel Fergus McGrain. Danny played for Celtic in 657 games, scoring 8 goals.

He's a member of the Scotland Football Hall of Fame, having won 62 caps.

A colossus as captain of club and country, Danny was Scottish Football Writers' Association Footballer of the Year 1977.

Trivia: In 1979 Albania barred Celtic Danny from entering the country because he had a beard!
